place.name: STOCKLAND BRISTOL
place.gazetteerText: STOCKLAND-BRISTOL, a parish in Bridgewater district, Somerset; on the coast, 6½ miles NW of Bridgewater r. station. Post town, Bridgewater. Acres, 1,650; of which 500 are water. Real property, £2,470. Pop., 142. Houses, 32. The manor belongs to T. Danie1, Esq. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £161.* Patron, T. Daniel, Esq. The church is early English. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
